reviews.review_msg: Lectures were really important but if you missed class it wasn't hard to keep up.. but if you want to do good in the class just stay up to date with the readings and lectures. she's kind of no BS on AI and other things but she's an easy prof to talk to and she will usually be in your best interest
She's on an ego trip.
she's extremely smart teaches in a way that requires you to make sense of the world around youâ€¦however extremely difficult professor and exams that don't make sense

Really awful teaching that made it very hard to actually want to learn. I am a dedicated enough student that puts in the work with my studies but this class was nearly impossible for me to learn anything even if I attended every single lecture. Would not take this professor again.

Professor is the only reason the course is hard. Condescending. Quizzes poorly made, trick questions, spelling errors rampant. Easy content. Presented dated misinformation on subjects of neurodivergence (autism, adhd) that probably made some students in the room uncomfortable.

Terrible professor. First class I showed up to she had a condescending tone towards the students answering the questions. She also swore during the lectures which I am okay with but it was very excessive, almost unnecessary. Thought she was having a bad day or something so I came back the next few classes but things didn't improve.
Horrible would be an understatement. Rude. Disrespectful. Does not care about any disability accessibility, and has made fun of individuals with certain issues in her lectures.
literally terrible, worst prof i have ever had. inappropriate in lectures and quiz/test material was not based off of any of the course material or readings
If I could give her a 0 I would have. Horrible teacher who believes that only she is right and not the textbook.
she is a power tripper who gets a hard on for being called DR. GORDON. if you wanna keep ur sanity DO NOT TAKE.
One of the best profs i've had at SFU so far. Cares about education and very approachable. Always willing to answer any type of questions.

Quizzes genuinely caused me so much distress, they contradicted textbook content, and oftentimes was not able to be answered by the textbook even though quizzes were open book. Luckily she gives partial marks for multiple choice on exams. She does go on tangents during lectures.

Gives partial marks on tests (all multiple choice) which is helpful for achieving good marks. She does go on tangents while lecturing and sometimes it's hard to follow. You will need to do a lot of reading.

DO NOT TAKE! she is not awful as a person im sure she is okay, and she is generally willing to give extensions if you need more time. HOWEVER ur garde is heavily dependent on tests and exams which are impossible! no matter how much u study you will be confused it feels like a trick. shes more of a researcher than a teacher to be honest.
Lectures are biased and based completely on her opinions, which were sometimes just not correct. She contradicts the textbook and basic knowledge of psychology, and her quizzes are impossible. Avoid.
Being some fentanyl to lecture because you need to escape her uncontrolled and excess yapping.

should be fired, without a 2 week notice with all of her contributions to psychology disregarded and immediately thrown into the dumpster. A total wreck to psychology. Singlehandly responsible for our mental illness crisis.
it is SO BAD, i wanna give you a zero, but that's not possible, so i give you a one
VERY generous with grading

Pros: entertaining lectures, that's about it
Cons: where to start. 
As mentioned by numerous people here, she is very disorganized with content, deadlines, and releasing grades. Her quiz/exam problems are IMPOSSIBLE. They are vague, ambiguous, and sometimes just contradictory. She seems like a fun person, but a terrible instructor. Avoid.

Quizzes are impossible to get 100% on. Overall grades are hidden till the end of the semester. Goes off topic a lot and does not give very good answers to questions asked in class. Sounds very aggressive when she talks as well. drinks vodka on zoom. You can tell yourself it gets better but it does not.
her quizzes are impossible to do well on, and shes lowkey so harsh do not take her at all

Class average was a D, does not care, skipped class for 1 month in a row due to a strike going on in a different union, cares more about her clinical psychology job, then teaching psychology. Avoid if possible, horrible and her midterms and quizzes are not based off of the lectures/readings etc., it is just randomized, information worded horrible.

Reading quizzes were horribly worded and she included answers based on what she believed is right, not what the textbook said even though it was a textbook-based reading quiz. Midterms were also confusing and contained information from the textbook, slides, and her lectures. However she contradicts with the textbook a lot, so you have no clue.

She talks a lot during lectures, but it isn't clear what is actually important vs what she's adding for the sake of adding. Almost all test questions were super vague and difficult to understand. Answers on quizzes were sometimes affected by her opinions, which conflicted with the textbook. The quizzes were exclusively based on the textbook. Avoid.

Unfortunately Iris has been the worst professor I've had so far. The main issue were her ambiguous quiz/test questions where all the answers may have been correct but she made you put yourself in her perspective to choose which answer she thought was best. Her lectures weren't too bad and I was still able to learn a lot, but she lacked organization

Some tips from me having had her twice (psyc201W: B+): read the textbook chapters and understand concepts - helped the most with quizzes and midterm exams! Go to lectures because even if it may seem boring she will slyly incorporate the answers to quizzes in her lectures (sometimes almost word by word). Exams = application-based m/c! Ask questions!

The WORST PROF in SFU!! Some of the  questions in quizes and exams were not in textbooks, slides, or even lectures!! I literally had no idea weherre she got these questions and answers!! She literally made them all so complicated for no reason. NEVER TAKE THIS CLASS!! I'm warning you guys i regretted not listening to the confessions before.

Class is curved, so getting a decent grade is very doable. Quizzes are tricky and based solely on the textbook. Exams can be tricky, but short answer questions are almost always things covered exclusively in lecture. Lectures are entertaining. Lots of reading and studying is necessary to do well.

Initially came across as amazing, but revealed herself to be the worst prof I've had (it's my second year of uni and I've been to 2 unis). Her lectures are pretty enjoyable, but neither those nor the textbook really help with quizzes/midterms. She is also very condescending when answering questions in person and over email. Avoid if possible.

I found her quizzes to be fair and most of the answers are found in the textbook. Lectures are very interesting and she cracks a lot of jokes. She gives part marks for the multiple choice questions on exams and explains concepts well in office hours. She's very approachable and nice, one of the best profs I've had so far.

potential was there because she can be funny and is clearly very knowledgeable -  but unfortunately just very bad at teaching. I didn't need to ask for extra credit but the email she sent out saying she would report anyone asking for extra credit assignments rubbed me the wrong way. I understand the job is hard, but be better.

Confusing. Was failing the course because we were only graded through exams for awhile, when I asked if assignments would raise my grade, she didnt respond to the email, becuase I didnt refer to her as "Dr Iris Gordon". Goes on tangents about autism, puts digestive system questions in a psyc course, and is just plain rude. SHE SHOULDNT BE TEACHING!

Hard class, but very interesting. Very doable if you put in the time and effort. Quizzes are tricky, but if you do them while reading the textbook chapter you'll do fine. Assignments are quite easy. Exams are challenging, but getting ~70-80% is doable if you study enough. Plan on 5-6 hours of work each week. The lecture were very entertaining.

Quiz & exam qs are incoherent. Studying the textbook was useless because the qs were things we never learned. Her correct answers are often false. She created a hostile environment. I emailed her to ask about quiz questions I got wrong that I thought were actually right and she accused me of grade-grabbing and threatened to report me. Unbelievable

Was by far one of the worst profs I've had at SFU. Talks more about autism, rape, sexual assault than the actual material. Contradicts what the textbook says. Exams were very difficult as what the textbook says is completely different from what her notes say and vice versa. Do not take any class with her if you can.

At first, I thought Dr. Gordon was at least okay, but she's not. Her tests and quizzes are incomprehensible if you're not her, but Iris herself is the least understanding and sympathetic prof I've ever had. (Even the TA's aren't that nice.) It's like she's preying on our downfall and WANTS her students to fail or something. I cried a lot bc of her

class was challenging, with difficult tests and quizzes, but relatively easy assignments. Despite intriguing subject matter, the teaching method made it difficult to understand creating a steep learning curve and the instructor's off-topic rants during lectures. Low average class in the 50s. For sure a GPA killer. Recommend another prof for sure!

I HATE THIS CLASS!! the way she words her questions on quizes and test are so confusing and hard for no reason? This class does noto need to be this hard for a 100 class!! Don't take it!! I'M telling I regret choosing thsi class.

Worst professor I had in my 3 years of university ever! She beats it out of all of them. Tests quizzes are unclear and TA's mark so hard it's so hard to meet the standards! My 400 level courses are much easier and makes more sense compared to this!

Extremely inflexible and unclear in assignment instructions. Will take marks off for formatting errors that were not even specified in the instructions and is unwilling to reassess. TAs mark just as hard and it is impossible to meet the standard. Multiple choice questions are confusing. 
Save yourself and avoid at all costs.

Worst prof at SFU, maybe even in BC. She should be so ashamed of having such bad reviews and class average. Def should re-evaluate her job because teaching clearly isn't it. Tests and lectures don't match, don't listen to the 1 positive review, it's just her writing them. Was fired from UVIC so that tells you everything you need to know. Awful prof
I already had serve depression and she not making it any better. This might be it.

The absolute worst prof of my entire existence. Literally took this class last year and here I am writing another review just to tell u guys how BAD she was. NEVER TAKE A COURSE WITH HER!!!!!! YOU'LL REGRET IT!!!!!!!

I knew her ratings before but I needed to take this sooner or later. Now I regret it with my whole heart!! She is the worst professor I have ever had and she LITERALLY MADE ME WANT TO CRY!! The ways she words her questions are so confusing, even though there is no need fot it be so confusing. DON'T TAKE HER CLASS even if you need it.
I'll pay you not to take this class. Please listen to the comments DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. There is better options TRUST ME ONG
POV: you read all the reviews but will take the class anyway because you believe you can get by it. I wish the class was full and never enrolled in it - biggest mistake of my life

It was worse than I had expected. Lecture slides contradict the textbook, quizzes and midterms are IMPOSSIBLE. The content is not hard BUT SHE MAKES IT HARD! IT TOOK HER THREE CLASSES TO COVER 22 SLIDES - never heard someone ramble so much nonesense in my life. I spent the whole semester just trying to survive. What an absolute joke of a class.

Tests and quizzes have little to no correlation with the lectures and textbooks. Multiple choice questions are strangely worded, and in most cases, all of the answers are applicable to the questions - very confusing. Lectures are more yap sessions. Extremely difficult for no reason.

Awful professor avoid at all costs. Quizzes are barely related to textbook material and questions have typos and are often hard to understand. Midterms are the same way. Awful prof would never recommend her courses ever. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Avoid if you can, her tests do not match the lecture material and require a lot of inference even with closed-book exams.  She is very knowledgeable but does not help students learn the material effectively.  One of the worst professors I have had regarding accessibility and student assistance.  Prepare to spend lots of time on this course.

Avoid her class if you can. She is extremely approachable and makes you feel dumb if you ask questions, goes on weird tangents and talks too fast. Her quizzes and exams have no correlation to lectures or textbook; half the time they are poorly worded or incoherent.

This was one of the most difficult classes I've taken. Iris is not approachable at all and does not seem willing to help her students. The tests and quizzes have no correlation to her lecture material or textbook, making it extremely tough to get a good mark on them. She makes lectures extremely uncomfortable with her offensive and strange rants.

Stay away from this professor... Even after the semester has ended she is trying to find any excuse possible to stick as many of her students with academic misconduct (there are prob gonna be a lot of false accusations). Her tests and quizzes are insanely difficult, assignment instructions are confusing and her lecture skills are horrible as well.

This professor has no regard for students as individuals. In the few emails I exchanged with her, she was not very kind. If you are not doing well in this class and reach out for help it seems as though she wants you to fail even if you're already not doing well. Quizzes and tests are difficult and don't relate to the lectures.
Horrible.

Her lectures are confusing and consists of long tangents where she rambles on about irrelevant material that is sometimes offensive. She had the genius idea of making exams online and CLOSED BOOK, then acted shocked when a majority of the class cheated (yet the average was still low 60s) Now she has spent the entire semester "hunting down" cheaters

Tests and quizzes very difficult despite doing the readings and going to lectures. Questions she creates on the quizzes are confusing and have answers that all somewhat make sense. Only way to make up is to do good on her#2 and #3 assignments.

This is an introductory course, yet the exams are made as if you have prior knowledge. She also claims that exams are 50/50 from the lecture and textbook, but there are things on exams that we never learned. The quizzes are also worded so strangely, that it makes it difficult to understand. Overall, just avoid her classes if you can.
Do not take any course with her. Her test questions are very difficult to answer and often not in the textbook or lecture.

Instructions are unclear, especially on assignments. TAs are tough graders, however Iris doesn't do anything to be somewhat considerate to her students. Quizzes are near impossible to even pass on, and exams (though online) are just as bad. Should've listened to other reviews/my friends who told me to avoid her. do yourself a favor and listen

Avoid this prof at all costs. Her quizzes and exams are impossible. The questions are way too advanced for the class when we are only learning basic concepts. Textbook readings and notes from her lectures don't help. She goes on rants in class about her clinical work instead of providing helpful information about the course content.

Avoid. Quiz and exam questions are nonsense and many are simply not possible to get right without guessing. Lectures are also hard to follow. Exams are supposedly 50/50 lecture and textbook, but some of these answers are found in neither. If you value your GPA take this course with someone else.

for your sanity don't take this course with iris. you will be confused the entire lecture, she doesn't talk about the material in the course she rants about her clinical work and then expects you to know all the material in her lectures plus the exams are actually impossible to get a decent grade on. if you like psychology don't take this course.

No matter how much you study or think you know, her quizzes and tests are impossible. They don't relate to the textbook or lecture slides. She is entertaining and makes an effort to keep students engaged during lectures but unless you want your gpa to drop, I would not recommend her class.

She's an entertaining prof to listen to. That being said, her quizzes are impossible. Nothing in her lectures/powerpoints are helpful towards learning material. She just tells stories and only addresses a small portion of material in class, the rest is in the textbook. She expects too much out of students who aren't being properly taught.

I am neurodivergent and the professor spent too long discussing autism/ADHD and "clinical" intervention therapies with autistic children. Overgeneralization, did not separate personality from diagnosis, patronizing undertones IMO, and class found some comments about autism humorous. Extremely anxiety-provoking dropped avoid-good students do poorly

I understand that Dr.Gordon could be demanding and insensitive. However, her class is interactive and she tries to make jokes to keep the class entertained. She also does small things to connect with students: giving a toast to everyone with bubble tea. I can see her enthusiasm in teaching! We should be more compassionate toward Dr.Gordon!
do not take this prof. She isn't too bad, but there are others that are much better.

She is a clinical psychologist (somehow) and all she does is relate her material back to clinical psychology. Which is great... except for the fact that this course is not about clinical psychology. So all of her lectures are basically useless and you have to rely on the textbook to pass. The quizzes and tests have the weirdest questions too.
Quiz questions and grades are nonsense.

She talks very fast and tends to ramble and get off topic, she'll also try to trick you before your understanding has solidified. She'll also never admit shes wrong and if you ask her questions she tends to repeat what she just said and doesn't answer them at all.

I enjoyed her lectures, but her personality is not for everyone. Assignments were easy, yet the TAs marked harshly and did not provide feedback. The quizzes were difficult and one time it told me that my answer was correct, but the actual correct answer was better. Tests were better than quizzes but still difficult and I usually did worse on them.

Dr. Gordon is a fair and very engaging professor; she frequently checked to see if anyone had questions and would spend a good amount of time to clearly answer them. Her exams are difficult because she has standards but her grading system is more than fair. If you go to lecture, do your readings and ask questions, a good grade is very attainable.

Professor Gordon does not teach. Her quizzes are open book but the questions and answers are very hard and are what she considers is right. The TAs are hard markers on assignments and tests. Her tests are hard and are extremely comprehensive. Should not be a 100-level course for the amount of content. She doesn't curve at all. AVOID IF POSSIBLE.

I really wish I had listened to the people who told me not to take this class with her. Honestly just wait it out till summer to complete this course with a different professor as doing well on the exams is near impossible. Assignments are the only place you can aim to raise your grade. For a first-year course, this class is extremely hard.

She kinda all over the place tbh but like the assingment s are pretty easy so that is something to really put effort into because your grade will  need it. Be prepared to read the textbook like a million times for a million hours because of how much information you need to know.

Great at lectures but they are hard to follow since she speaks so fast. Exams are so difficult: 50% textbook and 50% slides. Assignments' criteria are so broad yet the TAs marked them so hard? Still don't understand that part. Her grading system is good but exam-heavy which does not help. You basically teach yourself, and the content is DENSE.

all i'm gonna say is, good luck lol...
- way too hard for an intro course, take with another prof is you can

She tries to have a quirky and funny personality but just comes off as weird. Her exams are not fair, she teaches a lot in class and expects you to read the textbook as well, which I did, but I still have no clue where her exam questions come from. She literally boasts about the written part of her exams having a 30% average. Quiz averages are 50%.

Class is HARD but I disagree with all the people that think she's an evil witch. Lectures are interesting and engaging. Questions are encouraged, she makes lots of jokes and wants people to do well. Study a lot, pay attention & take notes, read the textbook- you'll be fine. Other reviews aren't wrong about the quizzes, choose answers VERY carefully

She is one of the smartest people I have met. With so much brand-new material, it is hard to remember it all AND be able to apply it in any random situation. The quizzes are difficult. Exams are also hard; also, definitely attend lectures and pay attention because she says a lot that's not included in the slides that you will have to remember.

Gordon is a decent prof, but has a few issues. Canvas page is bad as there are no separate pages for assignments or lectures, resulting in missed deadlines. Deadlines are at inconvenient times, unlike other professors. Lectures are content heavy, often missing slides, making it hard to concentrate. She is funny & answers most questions asked.

Open book quizzes are extremely hard with vague wording. Some information from her slides does not align with textbook info. Lectures are not very informative. Took this class as a requirement with lots of stress. I would avoid taking courses with her again.

Extremely vague and difficult open book quizzes. Quiz due dates are are assigned at the beginning of the semester so many times they're due before she's done teaching the unit. Lectures feel like rants maybe she does this to keep the class engaged but it doesn't work at all since the material she covers only scratches the surface.

Personally, funny and easily engaging.  Slides don't have a lot of info so you need to pay attention in class to get material you need. I found the quizzes harder than the exams. Wording is vague and further context is needed to understand some of the multiple choice questions. I didn't do great on the assignments but I feel like that's on me.

the worst prof i've EVER had in my entire life. tests are extremely difficult. no compassion whatsoever towards students. legit heard her tell a student that was asking for help to just study more. listening to her jokes is almost as painful as listening to her lectures. DO NOT TAKE, AVOID IF U WANT HAPPINESS.

Her quizzes and tests are extremely difficult to the point where it is near impossible to score decent on. All are based on lecture and textbook which is fine, however her lectures are not recorded, followed with hard to read power points. Textbook contains too much material to absorb everything in time for tests.
bruh

Dr. Gordon is the reason why i'm dropping out of psychology. She is a rude and insensitive person with an unprofessional way of 'explaining' course material. Tests and quizzes are filled with ambiguous wording that make it impossible to score slightly well. If you need this class, wait for a different prof to teach it for your own mental sanity.
very disappointed with this course and teacher. She comes off as rude and cranky which does not help her teaching. lectures are boring and the material is not well explained.

i feel it's important to include her strengths- expertise and humor. however:
her tests are so difficult due to their emphasis on her (VERY brief and unrecorded) slides and applied-learning. the quizzes do not prepare you. the textbook is a cakewalk, same one as psych100. it's confusing, disorienting and discouraging.

Her class is ridiculous, her tests are incredibly ambiguous and unrelated to material, she is very insensitive to extenuating circumstances. Her lectures are chaotic and unhelpful, always is rude to students who have questions, would never take a class with her again. Test questions are hard to understand and confusing, would give 0 stars.

Dr. Gordon is one of my favourite professors. Attendance isn't mandatory, but I'd attend all lectures as she uses material from both the textbook and in-class on her tests. You get what you put into her classes, so if you're expecting an easy psyc class, this isn't it. But if you want interesting, engaging, and intersectional, I highly recommend.

Iris is smart but her lectures can be hard to decipher, and her slides don't give enough information. you need to listen very closely to pick out any information. her question wordings on the test are so difficult to understand its overcomplicated. Overall she is respectable, and you can learn a lot from her but be prepared to study HARD

The exams are almost near impossible to get good on. Quizzes are not a GPA booster even though it's open book. Answers that are correct and the textbook proves it but it's marked wrong. She chooses what she thinks the answers are. Lectures are confusing. If you want a good mark, read the textbook multiple times, but it won't help with her exams.

Dr. Gordon ran very confusing and frustrating lectures. The material out of the textbook was easy enough to learn, but she talked in circles and was never very clear. For the tests and weekly homework quizzes, you need to figure out what she thinks the answer is. The assignments were easy, just not straightforward. I had a hard time with her style
Prof was very funny
Quizzes are vague, full of spelling errors, and use terminology not covered in lecture or the textbook. On one of the quizzes, the correct answer was actually misspelt.

I took psych 100 with Gordon and will soon have to take psych 102 with her as well. her lectures are okayish i guess but she is very rude to her students and I personally have been scolded at multiple times (for no valid reason). her tests do not help you learn material and are all mindless multiple choice tests which are impossible to study for.

Gordon is an incredibly funny professor. Her lectures are very fun to watch. However, her tests are very, very, difficult. Many little traps here and there to fall down. Need to know every little detail to get good marks. Definitely will drop your GPA if you're not incredibly careful. I want to like her, but her testing is too hard :((

Professor Gordon is a very difficult person to work with, her lectures are entertaining but being in her class was a challenge. The quizzes are practically impossible to do even though they're open book. Avoid taking a class with her if possible! It's a GPA dropper for sure.

I found Dr. Gordon to be a very interesting lecturer which made me enjoy showing up to her class, but DO NOT let that trick you. Her open book quizzes are far from GPA boosters. Questions on quizzes and exams seemed very subjective as well. Definitely recommend doing every grade booster given (6% for research participation) if you want to do well.

Really difficult tests and quizzes. The content on them was very specific, so unless you studied every little topic in depth, it was hard to do well. Lecture slides seemed a bit disorganized and were hard to follow. She made an effort to keep the class engaged by using examples and videos but it ended up just making it more difficult to understand

Do not take a course if taught my Dr. Gordon, for your own mental sanctity. One of the worst professors I have had in my first semester of university ever. For lectures, she talks about nonsense and makes it hard to take notes. She creates super hard quizzes every week. For exams, she makes them extremely hard and very specific. DO NOT TAKE!!!

Many people didn't like her teaching style, but I did. Make sure to attend every lecture and take notes as she speaks to make connections between the slides and the textbook. Her assignments were relatively easy as well. The quizzes were a bit difficult but they don't bring your grade down by too much anyways. Iris is a very engaging instructor too
Funny, but an asshole. Hard to approach. Conflicting material. Conflicting attitudes. Hard to understand views.

Gordon isn't a bad person at all but her course is quite difficult. All of the quizzes are open book which sounds easy until you try completing them. The tests are easier than the quizzes which says enough on its own. Honestly just read the chapters twice and try to correlate the notes with the lecture even though the lectures aren't very helpful.

I usually like psychology but Gordon made me hate it. Quizzes which were supposed to boost the grade were impossibly hard while being open book! Everything was worded too complicated and not clearly at all. Her lecture style was nit my favourite- she worded things in a way where everything was supposed to connect and click when it never did. Avoid!

My grade must have been pure luck as the average was C+ for an intro psychology course, would have dropped out if it was not a requirement. Quizzes are on content never covered or in textbook, theres multiple answers that are correct but she chooses which actually is. Lectures are disorganized and the exams are lecture heavy. dont take ever.

Exams and quizzes I found unrelated to slides in lecture. I found quizzes extremely difficult and felt as if I was being tricked on purpose with wording... basically every answer could be correct but only one was. Very hard to follow along, a fast-moving course, and unfair grading. Would not take again.

Drops lowest quiz, gives a higher weight on your best midterm mark. However, lots of readings, lectures can be dry, quizzes are tough, exams are tough. Assignments are easy though. STUDY lecture notes & textbook if you really want a good grade in this class. Quizzes are impossibly hard, and the lecture slides don't even make sense.
do not take a class with this professor her quizzes are so hard for no reason. She is highly unreasonable and what she teaches in lectures isn't even on the exams

nooooooo no no no no no no. been here for long enough and think that I'm a pretty average student id say. never had a professor as poorly put together as her. rude to students, constantly condescending and off-topic during lectures, and grades her midterms extremely hard. wait to take psyc 102 for someone else to teach the course

my experience with iris was very hot and cold. for our first assignment she never said anything about it until after it was due where we then had a pop quiz. for lectures she was pretty funny but would go off topic quite often. she would always be super moody on exam days and they were very difficult in that the material would be on a small details

Extremely hard to follow along in lecture, and the lecture slides are very confusing and pretty much impossible to understand. After taking notes on all the assigned textbook chapters and trying to comprehend her lecture slides, I find myself struggling to answer any of the test or quiz questions. She doesn't prepare you well for them at all.

Three midterms that are non-cumulative, which sounds nice but they are SUPER difficult, quizzes are nearly impossible to do good on, and the three assignments on APA are slightly 'easier' to do. This class is loaded with information and made to be super difficult for no reason. Gordon goes off topic often and doesn't elaborate on important topics.

After the first lecture, I could not stand this lady. 
She phrases things that are so mundane to listen to+her material in lectures doesn't correlate to anything on exams. 

-rely on the textbook, however, her exam questions are based loosely on the material and on questions/answers she just 'expects' you to answer 
-doesn't prep you well for exams

NONONO. in my 3 yrs at sfu I have never had such a terrible experience in a class. doesn't record lectures and notes on lec slides make no sense. weekly quizzes with multiple correct answers. what is said in lec contradicts the textbook. tries so hard to be funny but on god she high on smth. avoid at all cost. if ur stuck w her imma pray for you
This prof is off a perc on my momma

Make sure you attend class because some of the test content is based on slides she only presents in class (it is to check if you went/ paid attention in class.) Her quizzes are extremely difficult due to confusing wording and the answers being extremely similar. A lot of her quiz questions can not be found within the textbook or from lecture.

Quizzes/exams are awful - she says they're based on the textbook but some concepts the textbook doesn't even mention! Grading is SO subjective... there are multiple correct answers for assessments but she only picks 1 and won't listen if you disagree. She can be rude and goes on tangents. Her slides are unclear and lectures are painful. AVOID

She is an extremely hard grader. Her lectures are incredibly confusing, however her exams are 50% based off her lectures. Questions on the quizzes are quite confusing as they are not covered in the lecture or textbook. The class feels extremely disorganized as well. The dates on the quizzes were constantly being changed
tests were so hard.

Her weekly quizzes have multiple correct answers, that often aren't found in the textbook or lectures. The mean for quizzes are often low and she goes on tangents in class instead of teaching and often goes off topic. She expects you to memorize the textbook and asks about the smallest details in midterms instead of the bigger theories and concepts
A better choice than the rest for this course?

There is too much to cover in class so it's not possible for her. She is really good teacher, you can ask her for help and she would help you. Psychology is boring. She tests mostly on concept and doesn't encourage memorizing. If you read books which she encourages from day 1 you are good.
She's funny and very helpful.  *Some of the material she doesn't cover in her slides are on the midterms so make sure you get a copy of the textbook.
no comm

Caroline is monotone and has no enthusiasm in what she teaches. Her tests are also very inconsistent with the material she teaches. For our most recent midterm, there were questions so specific and was never mentioned in her lectures but expects us to know everything in the textbook. In the end, if you want to get a good grade dont take this class

Dr. Lim, while an engaging lecturer, is not an understanding professor. She does not provide accommodations regardless of documentation or circumstances on assignments. She can often be blunt and seems to expect her students to work as if they are machines. Her exams are heavily based on the textbook and difficult. Would avoid if possible!

She's a wonderful lecturer and person. The only thing is that she expects the whole textbook to be known, regardless of whether or not she mentioned certain topics in class. Other than that she's wonderful
lectures went over all the basic concepts from the textbook which was very helpful. responds to emails fast. nice lady. paper was graded pretty tough but depends on your TA

Most boring class ever, you MUST read the textbook and memorize literally all of it or you won't do that good. The average was extremely low. This prof and class isn't anything special, the content isn't too hard but this class just has so much info and it's so boring that it makes it hard. The wording on her exams is also weird.

Pretty straightforward prof, she tells you what she expects out of you and as long as you stick to readings and lectures youll be fine, doesn't try to trick you and was graded on 4 exams and one paper, as well as weekly quizzes. Shes a really nice prof super understanding and open to offer help.

The class material was very easy but she had some ambiguous questions on the exam where either answer are correct and you must choose the best answer which honestly you could argue is subjective. There's three exams and one essay which is graded very tough and I felt the guidelines were not very clear for the essay content. Lots of weekly reading.

Dr. Diana Lim is an amazing prof. I was a little iffy about taking her class cuz to the mixed reviews but she is a really caring teacher. Her lectures cover most of the main ideas but you should read the textbook to get the nitty gritty details. There are weekly quizzes based off the content covered that week and exams are straightforward.

Kind and encourages questions. Exams are very related to the textbook which is where most of your time is spent for the course. Questions on the exam were pretty fair assuming you properly read through the textbook and took notes on the key ideas.

She had engaging lectures that had you interact and brainstorm, which I appreciated. She seemed very passionate about the subjects that were discussed and took the time to answer our questions. Her exams were not very difficult and focuses mainly on the big ideas. She had weekly quizzes, which could give more credit! 

I would definitely take again

not great prof.didn't use a specific word they wanted on an exam and got no marks for the question. the material isn't hard to learn, its the expectation they have that make it impossible to do well even though its intro psyc. quizzes and exams are hard if you dont read EVERY word of the textbook you won't do well. very low class average

Diana was a great prof, no complaints with her in terms of explaining concepts and her lectures were also recorded. Only issue was the significant weight the textbook held on exams and quizzes, so you do have to read it in order to excel (and it is EXTREMELY dry). Other than that, the course is manageable as long as you keep up with readings:)
Very clear criteria and well organized. Exams and quizzes are tough, but is marked fairly. Her lectures cover the overall topics, but encourages us to read the textbook as well.

The professor is decent at best. The lecture covers basic concepts and is hard to sit through at times. Must read/review the whole textbook to get a good grade. The exams/quizzes are doable but made to trick you. The professor is strict and does NOT set up students to succeed. If Psyc 102 is a requirement take it with a different professor.

Great at teaching core concepts for the class, all of the assessments were very fair. The TA's were very nice and helpful, but their marking was surprisingly difficult. On two of my exams, I had the right idea but lost marks because I didn't use certain words. Otherwise solid class.

I had professor Lim twice and she was always super nice to listen to. Her classes were very engaging and she explained all the concepts really well. The only thing that bothered me was the curved grading, since I did really well in the weekly quizzes and exams but ended up with only a B+. Other than that, it was a great class.

Before taking Dianas class I had heard a lot of mixed reviews about her, some of those are correct while others arent. She is a nice and lovely prof who speaks in a gentle tone. The only thing with Diana is that her quizzes/tests are way too difficult for what she teaches. Its doable, however its almost like she wants to see you get tricked.

Had her a 2nd time and I really liked her clarity and care for students with questions. Her lectures highlight the key points in each chapter that's most likely to be tested on, so exams/quizzes are straightforward (also open-book). As long as you understand the lecture content and skim the textbook, you'll be fine.

Dr. Lim is a respectful and kind professor, but everything is rigorously graded by her and the TAs. Difficult to reach as needed, her lecture chapters are only partially covered, and there is not enough material to prepare for the exam, so you have to be willing to teach yourself from the textbook.

Dr. Lim is wonderful! Her passion shines through in lectures and makes you feel excited about the subject as well. Tests were open-book and mostly based on the textbook so make sure to take good notes. The written assignment was very short and super easy since it was based on your psychology in your personal life.
Her lectures are what the tests are about. Nothing difficult and easy to approach to. For each exam and quiz just read the textbook and you will be fine.

Probably my favourite professor so far, reading the textbook and attending lectures is all you really need to pass/understand the course, lectures always help clarify important topics in the textbook! Dr. Lim is also helpful at answering questions in class, and there's always polls/activities to do in lectures which is fun
Diana has an amazing passion when talking about the lecture material and reasonable tests from lecture material.

SFU needs better professors. If you enjoy getting a C+ please take Dr. Lim Lectures are confusing, large portion of materials tested are not covered in lectures. spends too much time irrelevant information that is never tested. She also needs better and more informed TA's.

Dr. Lim is by far the worst professor I have ever taken. Her excuse for a ridiculously low class average is "this is normal for a first year 100 level course" what does that even mean? How about quiz us on lecture material and not random stuff never discussed nor found in the text or the lecture.

Decent professor. Content is easy enough and quizzes/tests/exams are quite straight forward. However, despite being a decent professor, this semester's PSYC 102 class had some of the worst TAs I've ever witnessed. Tough graders for a first year class and very unapproachable. Even so, its manageable and still easy to get a good grade.
Dr Lim is one of the best profs at SFU and is a QUEEN. Her lectures are not confusing and are easy to follow I would 100% taking a psyc course with her.

Gives great engaging lectures, doesn't require attendance in class and always posts the lecture recordings. She actively seeks out student feedback throughout the semester and changes her lecture style and material based on class needs.

Dr. Lim really wants you to succeed and that's evident. Her lectures are informational and correlate to work from the textbook so I recommend reading the chapter ahead of the lecture so it really sticks. She is an incredible lecturer and I really enjoyed her class. I am planning to take PSYC100 with her the next time she teaches it. 100% recommend!

Loved this class and this professor! Would 100% take any of her other classes. She's fun and makes everything clear. If u like psych already she will make u love it even more. Genuinely nice and easy to understand. She wants the best for u and gives u time to submit quizzes. You will need to read the textbook chapters that go with the lectures.

She's a really great prof and her lectures sum up the textbook but gives good examples and if you like people telling you about the textbook instead of reading she is good for that. Although you should still read the textbook. She's nice and jokes around at times. Overall good time in her class.

Material and concepts are fairly easy to understand but Dr. Lim likes to confuse you. Only after asking her 3 times, she could answer me that in the exam I was supposed to apply the theory that is still relevant in psychology today instead of one that would have suited but is considered historic. Tutorials are a waste of time.

Dr. Lim is nice but she marks way too hard imo. Tests were quite difficult and vague on what would be tested, they did not match the difficulty of the weekly quizzes. The assignment was marked very hard and she basically said it was because we were inexperienced first years. No specific feedback on tests, quizzes, or paper unless you make a meeting

I wish that she released the averages for tests and quizzes, as well as told you what questions you messed up on but that's only possible if you attend office hours-- kinda annoying. The paper is graded pretty harshly compared to the tests but if you read the TB and watch the lectures, you're fine. She is sweet, and talks about her nephew a lot :)

Gives vague, non-answers when asked about assignments/quizzes. Lecture examples are identical to the textbook. If you are still confused and ask for clarification, she just repeats the same example again, giving no new insights. Quizzes are 30% trick questions, designed to trip you up. I had to scour the book for minutia. Textbook taught the class.

Ive done 2 (out of 3) exams and weekly quizzes so far. I read the textbook and take notes before watching the lectures and taking the quizzes. Overall, I recommend this prof. Dianas lectures confirm whats important from the textbook, and her quizzes/tests accurately test my understanding. Do your readings, and you will like this class!

Not clear with grading criteria. Records lectures in separate segments but focuses little attention on the lectures, and a heavy majority on the textbook so much so that tests and quizzes end up being predominantly obscure, specific questions taken directly from the textbook. The course composed of tests and quizzes, which have short durations.

The only way you can get a good grade on the exams is if you memorize every detail from the text book. Exams are ridiculously focused on minor details, so you have to read the textbook as her lectures only cover the basic topics. Grading criteria was also bad, she did not round up so a 70.6 will be a 70 not a 71.

Dr Lims's exams are very deep and heavy. You need to read every single line in the text book and understand the material deeply because she is going to give you scenarios based on the information. Also, she does't want anyone to reach out to her regarding the marks and grades!! she won't respond you
Her teaching is not that bad, but the grade distribution is terrible. Like normally a 86 is an A- but it is B+ in this class, so be aware of it.

nice person but her 14% essay completely ruined some peoples marks. she made It seem very casual and easy but did not mark that way at all. got A's and A+ on all 3 exams and average of 90% on her quizzes but finished with a B+ in the end cuz of her paper marks. use the textbook, it helps more than her lectures and exams based off TB basically

Dr. Lim is a solid professor. She is organized and communicates clearly. Her weekly recorded lectures were broken up into a series of mini lectures posted on a weekly schedule. I personally did not find the weekly live meetings to be of value. I would suggest integrating mini writing assignments to prepare students for the term paper.

Great course for people who don't like writing, there was just one easy 500-800w essay. I found that writing my own notes from the textbook was easier and better for quizzes & exams as her lectures are quite long but not that detailed. I like that she asked for our feedback around midterm time and implemented changes that most of us asked for.

Dr. Diana Lim gives great advice on how to study for her class which I appreciate. However, she does not give great feedback and is a tough marker on papers. Her lectures were also quite useless to me. I actually found the textbook far more helpful when it comes to studying for quizzes and tests. So get prepared to read A LOT.
no feedback, useless lectures, long readings, its an intro class
Psyc102 isn't a necessarily hard class. Diana Lim gives good lectures. Very clear with expectations and outlines, with plenty of stuff to grade on to get an overall good grade on.

Dr. Lim was a great prof!! She explains concepts clearly, is open for office hours and uses visuals in lectures videos a lot to cater towards visual learners as well. I would 100% take another class with her again!

I don't understand all of the negative comments here... I had Katherine for Psyc 100 last semester, and I had her again for 102 this semester; her lectures are engaging, she is fun to talk to, she loves the material, and her marking scheme (including her exams, quizzes, and assignments) is very fair. Her TM Sara is awesome, too!

I've heard mixed things about her but I loved her. Yes, there is a lot of content to study for for her exams, but to me that was expected and if you read the textbook and spend a bit of time studying, you'll do fine (even with her grading scale). I wouldn't take this class for an easy breadth course but if you like this subject, she's awesome!

The exams are heavy same as the quizzes. Lots of stuff on the exam arent based on her notes so make sure to read the textbook. In my opinion, this course is way too heavy for an intro class. She lists out the things that were going to be tested and NONE of them ended up being on the exam.

One of the best profs I have ever had. She was very good at teaching and explaining concepts, while keeping the lectures interesting and engaging. We had a cheat sheet for every test, which was extremely helpful. There were some specific questions on exams, but if u do the reading and go to lectures, you shouldn't have much trouble with the class.

A lot of ppl complain about the grading scale, but they're just not willing to put in the effort to read the textbook. Psyc has standard grading regulations because concepts are so intuitive, students rarely fail. The class average was 82%, and Dr. Croft made an A+ a 93 and up! She rlly tried her best to make the course accessible for everyone :))

besides this class being a huge GPA booster (bless), it rlly drew me into psyc like im actually considering a psyc minor now because Dr. Croft was just so enthusiastic and passionate about the course! she rlly loves teaching and her energy is infectious. such a gem of a professor
10/10 would a thousand times recommend. such a sweet professor!!!

k im not sure why there are so many low ratings because Dr. Croft is genuinely such a great professor!!! Psyc 102 was an awesome experience and I have zero complaints. She made things easy at a systemic level, allowing 5 tries for the practice quizzes, cheat sheets for every midterm, and even a bonus exam. it doesn't get any better than that :0

Dr. Croft is super sweet & engaging in lectures. she expends on content from the textbook in different ways to help everyone understand & encourages questions. lectures & essay made concepts practical & relatable. she offers resources like a bonus exam & suggested due dates & shows she genuinely wants us to succeed. study and you'll be fine

Dr. Croft was great as an intro-psyc teacher. She made the lectures super engaging and used supplemental materials like videos to break up the lectures (because they where 3hrs long). Super kind and seemed to really care about students. Tests were fair, as long as you pay attention in class you will do great. Overall great teacher!

Really nice person, not a great prof. Exams were frequent and nitpicky. Often came across as a bit patronizing-- we aren't children. Very easy course but far from engaging. I went to three lectures total, studied a day before each exam, and pulled an A. Be aware that incredibly specific details may be tested on, so read the darn textbook.
nice person but not a good prof her lectures were not the best and her quizzes were so hard for no reason. All the exams we got a cheat sheet

Harsh grader, even the smallest detail will be tested. We had a cheat sheet for every exam which was nice though but even if you do well like a low 80 it'll still be a B, whereas in other courses it would be an A-. Lectures were fine but do the readings ahead of time.

Why do we get tested on every little irrelevant thing within the textbook? It's super frustrating when a cheat sheet can't even help because you'd have to write verbatim from the textbook. She's nice though
Overall Alyssa is a nice person but as a prof she isn't my favourite. Doesn't have enough info on her slides either

Great professor. Super knowledgeable, but also really lovely and clearly cares about the success of her students. There is a good amount of reading, but her lectures generally complemented them well, and her exams were always reasonable.

Alyssa Croft is an excellent professor for psychology. Her jokes of the day and lecture slides provide an exciting learning experience. Most of the course relies on textbook anyways, prof makes little difference

Super sweet and caring to students. Exams were very straight forward, but you will be tested on videos and things she shows in class so keep that in mind when studying. I think she did a great job at helping students understand and enjoy the content. Not hard and sometimes allows cheat sheet for exams.

Super nice lady. I find long lectures hard, but her 3 hour class was bearable. You need to read the textbook to supplement the lectures, or vice versa, as the exams cover both. She does an exam after every few chapters (4 total, optional online final). Grading is hard but the same scale as the PSYC100 I took with someone else so I was used to it.

Overall nice lady and cares about her students! However her grading is horrible. A C is a 70% and if you want to get an A it's a 90% and higher.
Unfair grading and her quizzes are harder than the exam. If you care about your gpa take a different psych prof if you want fair grading!

Definitely make sure to read the textbook. The chapters were pretty long but as long as you do your reading every week you will be okay. Her exams were good, no midterms or finals, just exams after 4-5 units, multiple choice.

Generally a good professor. Very kind and easy to talk to. The assignment that was worth 10% of your grade was easy. It really is not that difficult of a class, and she is lovely to talk to. Just focus on the readings, and use the lectures as either a textbook summary or to figure out what she is focusing on.

I got an 82% in her class WHICH FOR SOME REASON = A B-????????? GPA KILLLERRRR avoid her class at ALL COSTS 

shes a nice person dont get me wrong, but and awful grader and her tests were (especially the first one) were overly difficult.

To anyone who's saying the complaints regarding her grading scale are for people who did not put in the work, that is a very unfair assumption. Her grading scale is in an N.99 cutoff and does not round up, which means the 0.01 percent can make a difference in your letter grade, which I find extremely ridiculous. If you can, choose another prof.

Dr. Croft is a lovely person and manages to make 3 hour lectures bearable.  The poor reviews are coming from people who were expecting this class to be an easy A.  Her grading scale is odd, but the exams/material were not difficult; if you work hard you will do well.  Make sure you read the textbook, because not all material is covered in class.

Though she only reads off of slides, they contain useful supplementary material, and ctrl c+ctrl v from the textbook. T.A's graded generously and most marks came from 3 midterms + 1 small paper (easy). She is very easy to talk to, and seems to care about all of her students. 

*Grading scheme is tough (90% = A-), but reasonable for the material.*
Lectures aren't to boring but can be exhausting as they are 3 hours long. The course material wasn't difficult and her exams weren't that hard either. Grading system is definitely flawed tho
RIDICULOUS and HORRENDOUS grading scheme. Low 90 is an A-? 89 is a B+? Croft makes this course hell by implementing her own grading scheme.

RIDICULOUS grading scheme. never been in a class that scales u DOWN instead of up. low 90 is an A-? 89 is a B+? class was supposed to be my gpa booster but might just be my lowest grade this semester. meant to be an easy class, half the content is common sense, but for whatever reason, croft makes it hell by implementing her own grading scheme.

AVOID THIS CLASS AT ALL COSTS. For an introductory level class she has such unrealistic standards? Her grading scale baffles me and I am not sure why it is even implemented once again for an INTRO class. Her tests are extremely hard, take my ADVICE and never ever attend her lectures but rather use the class time to go through the textbook. 1/10

AVOID AVOID AVOID AT ALL COSTS!! GRADING SCALE IS RIDICULOUS! LECTURES ARE 3 HOURS LONG WITH ONLY A 10 MINUTE BREAK IN BETWEEN. EXAMS ARE DIFFICULT!!! I STRUGGLE WITH EXAMS. DOING THE EXAMS IN THIS COURSE MADE ME SUPER NERVOUS AND ANXIOUS. HEAVY TEXTBOOK...ONLY GOOD THINGS ARE  OPEN BOOK QUIZZES, TERM PROJECT AND RPS CREDITS. TA'S ARE HARD MARKERS!

If you care about your gpa dont take this class with this prof. If you need this class for your degree take it with someone else. She makes it sound like shes doing you a favour with her shitty grading system but its terrible. She makes it that you have to score a 70% in the class to get a C-. if you get 69% you get a D. She should be fired asap.

Genuinely avoid this professor at all costs as all her lectures are almost never on her exams and they're all textbook based. Her TAs aren't any better as they mark so heavily it's impossible to actually pass this course. Also the last chapter on each exam is almost never present on them.

Her lectures are VERY fast so prepare to take a lot of notes. This is also a very heavy textbook reading class and her test relies completely on the reading. Each chapter is like 80-90 pages long and you have to memorize all that information. Her tests are also ridiculously hard since they are hard markers, and also anything under a 60% is a fail.

decent prof but no point in going to lectures, just read the textbook. tests are fully based off the textbook which is very content heavy and requires so much memorizing, but not too bad overall. definitely don't cram

HORRIBLE. Her lecture are so fast, she believes that students are robots. Exams are too specific and the sfu grading scale? I did all this effort to get an average GRADE unless you are perfect and get above 90 you get an A Horrible grading scale for a 100 LEVEL COURSE. She only bombs you with information for 3 hours and gives a 10 minute break.

Skip lecture. Read the textbook. She asks questions off video in the lecture but that's it. Exams are easy if you read the textbook and they consist of mc, t/f and written. There are open-book quizzes, a syllabus quiz and RPR credits that are worth 20% in total and those are easy grade boosters so do well on those. The grading scale is ridiculous.

Grading system is ridiculous for an intro course. Although the lectures are 3 hours they don't provide any information that will help you get a good mark in this class, you're better off just studying off the textbook which is content heavy on its own. Oh and if you're looking for help, good luck booking officer hours with the TA or the Prof

Dr. Croft was super sweet. The grading scale was initially terrifying, anything under 60% is a fail and under 70% is a D- for a 100 level course. The lectures were interesting and she added lots of videos, buzzed quizzes and things to keep the lectures engaging. The exams are really easy if you study and the last midterm had a cheat sheet.

don't be fooled that she's a nice lady her grading system really isn't nice. skip the lectures and use that time to study on your own instead - she does NOT cover even half of the content on the exams in her lectures. everything you need to know is in the textbook. waste of my time while wasting my mental health.

reading the textbook and taking notes go a long way in this course. i encourage attending his in-person lectures; they can be helpful and he tells you what to focus on. recorded lectures aren't needed to do well. the TAs that mark the written assignments can be hard markers! exact same format as psyc 100, just different content. [spring 2022]

Exams were fair, be prepared to read the textbook & memorize every small detail. No need to go to lectures or watch his videos. Marks depend on the TA for writing assessments but they marked harshly with little feedback & never replied to any of my emails. Also he gives very confusing topics for the writing assessments so it dropped everyone's mark

I got good vibes from Russell! Obviously a class with 400 people is not very personal and you do basically teach yourself from the textbook, but the quizzes/tests/assignments are very reasonable and I had a good experience in this class.

Dr. Day is a very caring prof as he grades 6/8 quizzes and 3/4 exams. He understands that students are struggling with the online environment and he is very accommodating. I can't think of an issue with Dr. Day as his TA selection is good as well as his quizzes as they are based off the book. His lectures can be dry at times though.
I said it once, and i'll say it again, just read and study the textbook like your grade depends on it and this course will be the easiest A you have ever received in your academic career.

Super boring class, with some interesting chapters from the textbook. Dr. Day is a really nice and accommodating prof, very knowledgeable too. Would take a class with him again, as this class fosters independent learning.

Day seems like a nice guy but his lectures are pretty dry and boring. Lectures and live meetings are not worth attending/watching, just make sure to understand the textbook fully. The tests and quizzes are worth 76 percent of your grade in total, and 2/8 quizzes and 1/4 tests are omitted. Very easy class overall that requires little effort.

Dr Day is a great lecturer, even though he says "in terms of" at the end of his sentences. Some of the quiz/exam questions are ambiguous, try not to read too much into them. He gives lots of opportunities to make up marks by dropping lowest exam and quiz scores and giving bonus questions. Entertaining lectures.

Class was fair, especially considering COVID circumstances, he really did his best to accommodate the situation. Classes were important on days where there were iClicker quizzes, but overall test material focused on textbook readings.

Lectures aren't necessary, tests are on the tricky side. He is an ok lecturer but made a few inappropriate/creepy comments. The class overall is a lot of upkeep, and the new book is a lot harder to read than the old edition. I studied a lot but still barely passed most of the midterms. Other assignments help to grade boost. Class average was a C+

You do not need to buy the textbook or go to the class because he uses the US version of the txtbook which is available online and has lectures online too incase you cant find something. Make sure for the written section, you put down literally everything related to the topic and atleast 1/2 sources to get a good mark.

Cant say too much when the first essay exam mean were 30% I think at least 20% ppl will fail this class because he never tell you what he expects on the essay Boring lecture with useless content which you can find on textbook anyways Just dont take it with him. If you take it then good luck with you

The class is literally the textbook. Just memeorize the textbook and you'll do fine, his lecture's are somewhat related but you don't need to study them at all, the entire test is based on the textbook. The essay answers are marked farily hard for a first year course.
Hes test was too much detail and the essay avg was 30% with no curve grading :( Hes lecture was useless because the most of exam are based on textbook.

makes psyc102 unnecessarily hard and the grading scheme is tough even though you drop a quiz 6/7 and a test 3/4 written sections are harshly marked - you have to memorize what he wants really have to get the concepts down would be better if class was curved would not take again too difficult for a 100 level course
Attendance is unnecessary, this course is 100% textbook based. Don't waste your time going to class, just memorize the textbook. Heavy but true.

Lectures were boring so I stopped attending. The lectures are recorded but all you need to do is memorize the textbook because more than half the stuff he says in class isn't on the exam. Four exams and 7 or so quizzes with the worst mark for both dropped. He isn't that bad but he wasn't my kind of prof. Good luck!

His lectures are not related to exams. You have to read everything on the textbook. If you went his office hour, he just told you what textbook said. I got my lowest grade in this class. Launchpad is useful for quizzes.
Lectures were super bland and uninteresting. They just dragged on for what seemed like infinite amounts of time. Doesn't explain anything well, and is just repeating the textbook.
Don't need to show up for lectures. He just outlines everything that is already in the text, maybe elaborates a bit. Get launchpad and do quizzes for practice, and you have an easy A.
Long lectures, but he's easy to listen to. Makes jokes and uses videos often. His tests are made up mostly of things from the textbook.

Great prof. Lectures are interesting and engaging. He drops your lowest quiztest which is awesome. Expect to read 30-40 pages per week. The essay part can be tricky. We had to write essays for 3 of our exams and the average for the essay portion was slightly over 50%. Definitely expect to put effort in. I ended up with an A.
Nothing he tests on was from his actual lecture slides (which are based on another older textbook for some reason). Just read the textbook and you'll do fine.
Terrible prof. Lectures were useless. Just read the textbook and you should be fine.

Material was interesting but the class was boring. Multiple choice questions are rather easy but essays are ridiculously hard to get a good grade on. The averages of the essay question are approximately 50%. I'd recommend taking this class with another professor if possible.
Material isn't that hard but exams are ridiculously tough. The essays are extremely tough. Definitely not the best Psychology prof out there as I've had better Psychology profs.
Very funny lecturer that makes going to class worth it even though the audio can be found online. Tests and quizzes are straightforward and questions are based on the textbook readings.

A good majority of the lectures are not mandatory to attend, bc IClicker quizzes and exams usually revolve around the tb. LOTS of information to read over. (especially if you are taking this alongside PSYC100)

Lectures aren't mandatory I never went to them unless there was a iclicker quiz (out of 10 and questions are straight from the textbook) or a midterm. Midterms mc questions are straightforward the essay is tough! Basically read the textbook and be good at memorizing. If you got those two things down this class is pretty darn straight forward!

Horrible grading and percentage ranking! Especially midterm, essay question is not expecting, multiple choice is like reading question. No way!!!! I spend so much time in reading his text, and it is horrible.

MY FIRST AAAAAAAAAAAAAA I'M SO HAPPY but seriously study don't cram everything the night before the final, you need 50% on the final to pass the course for psych 102...other than that you'll do great WOOOHOOOOOOO CHRISTMAS TIME BABY

Dr Day is actually a really nice prof! The only thing that I dislike is his lecture notes are no help! Everything is based on textbook! Midterm consists of 30 mc and 2 essays and 90 mc for final! Despite his teaching style, he is a really nice person :) !

Can't decide whether or not I like him. Pros: VERY organized, clear, and pretty fair overall. Cons: Sometimes words questions in an unfavourable way, iClicker quizzes are kind of hard, midterm essay questions marked extremely hard. Very important to read the textbook in this course, as quizzes and midterms are based almost entirely on text

Excellent prof! Interesting lectures, but only add background knowledge to the concepts. Study the textbook as everything is based off this. Marks the essays pretty roughly. It's possible to get a great grade in this course, but you need to treat it like a science instead of an easy 100 level course.

The clicker questions are not easy, they're scenarios and then you have to decide which theory it is referring to. If you're a person who usually just likes to study the powerpoint slides and not the textbook, tough luck because his slides contain no info. You'll only get a good mark if you really take the time to read every detail in the textbook.

PSYC is not an easy, wishy washy course. It's a science, and should be studied with similar rigor. My only explanation for the negative ratings is that these students obviously did not try very hard in the course itself. Russell Day is an excellent prof, very funny and obviously passionate about his subject. Just do your readings, and take notes.
Read the textbook lectures are useless and midterms are super hard
VALUE he says value a lot
DO NOT RECOMMEND AT ALL,,I don't know what he is taking about during lecture. His voice just makes me want to sleep!! MTs are nightmares,,, He talks about topics that are irrelevant,,
His power points were useless. always take about stuff that is not related to class. midterms and finals are hard and seems like you never heard of that topic before cause he never eve mention it!

I was expecting a GPA booster, because, well, it's psych, but NOOO. He has to word questions ambiguously so you don't even know what he's asking. You have 80' to complete 2 essays and 30 MC.  I would study at least 20 hours for each MT and rewrote all the chapters, but the TA's marked super hard.

His lectures are useless because he will give you a bare bones explanation. Go if you have a quiz/midterm otherwise it is a waste of time. You pretty much pay 500 to teach yourself! The text will be your best friend in this class so read it! Lucky for you the material unlike him is actually really interesting. Good luck!
he explains very thoroughly

If it's available with Alder, take it with Alder. Day's lectures are slow and covers the very obvious sections. Also, more essays on exams makes it harder than Alders for a good mark.

No point in going to lecture, besides the tests/quizzes (all from textbook). Midterms' written component marked ridiculously hard, and the assignment was very unclear. Prof is not very approachable, even if you just email, he gives off the attitude you're just wasting his time.

Dreadfully boring. Lectures are poorly regurgitated material from the textbook, and he spent far too much time fretting over administrative nonsense rather than teaching what little content he did. You could pass this course without showing up once; it's all in the textbook.

Professor Day is an absolute delight. He is very enthusiastic about the material and a joy to listen to. His lectures don't do much to help with the quizzes and exams, though, so just study the book and you'll be fine.
Prof. is funny and nice guy. However, materials are little bit harder than i expected. There are 3 midterms, 1 finals, and 8 quizzes..too much works for 1st year student.

In general, this course is a HEAVY workload course, with quizzes every week, 3 midterms, an essay, and research participation!  However, hard work definitely pays off in this class!  This course is recommended for students who are amazing at memorization of terms and concepts.  If not, (and it isn't a requirement) dont take it.

Boring!  I had him for PSYC 100 and found him to be somewhat interesting; however, his teaching style gets so repetitive and uninteresting.  Plus, if you ever realize that he uses "Etc. Etc." way too often, usually when it doesn't apply, you will never be able to regain focus.
Good prof, bad TA's. Lose marks for having wrong font on a paper, etc...
Best prof I have ever had!
A fun teacher who keeps the class interesting, and is always ready to help a student.

Interesting Prof, though lectures weren't very necessary for midterms/final.  The course had a lot of components, though with effort they could be successfuly completed.
funny, dont make u fall asleep..but must must MUST read the text book..exams comes more from text then notes
He was great, what more can I say. He was clear, answered questions and the work load was fine. Great prof and great course.
Fun and engagine prof.  overall not a hard course, i put in little effort and still manage to get a B..

Extremely good prof. His lectures are well organized and informative. The exams are fair and you'll do fine as long as you keep up with the readings. I found the marking scheme on the assignments to be pretty generous.

funny prof, nice to talk to about any issues concerning the course....however, too much info required to know for the test (ie. textbook AND supplementary material), marking is a little bit too hard...in general, good prof

She is a very nice person and teacher but her exams are very tough indeed. Although I aced the written portion of her midterms, her MC questions were ridiculous! Make sure you know every detail from the textbook and her notes.
Nice and friendly prof, easy to approach but her exams are quite difficult. Studying from the textbook is essential.

he was good. very interesting. fair tests. no complaints

i love baddie teacher yummy

Despite the long lectures and readings, I really enjoyed this class. I found the prof to be very friendly, upbeat, and caring. He wants for everybody to do good in his class. An easy A as long as you read and study from the study guides he provides. Assignments are a breeze.

Michael is great guy and tries his best, my advise is read the book where the exams questions come and get his bonus point because they have a huge impact on the grade. The only negative thing  about him is that should spend more time for lecturing than repeating last week material.

Your textbook will be your best friend as she only teaches 1/2 of what actually is on the tests. Besides that, she makes the topics easy to understand and shows videos that help our understanding. All in all not a bad prof at all

She is very strict and tends to get off topic a lot. Her tests are fair but long and tricky sometimes. I wouldn't take it with her

easy first year course, but .... I felt the use of the textbook started to become more heavy around when the course was ending. Other wise, great prof, great for first years! She's a very kind professor who is very straightforward with her tests. Sarah definitely is clear with what you need to know and is fair!

She is the most amazing professor I've ever met. She likes what she teaches and helps out the students as much she can. She is so approachable. Her PowerPoint is pretty unclear?
